org.netbeans.api.java.source.matching

Class Pattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.netbeans.api.java.source.matching.Pattern

  • public class Pattern
extends Object
    A pattern occurrences of which can be searched using Matcher.

      • createPatternWithFreeVariables

        @NonNull
public static Pattern createPatternWithFreeVariables(@NonNull
                                                              TreePath pattern,
                                                              @NonNull
                                                              Map<String,TypeMirror> variable2Type)
        Creates a pattern that contains free variables. Tree nodes that are semantically equivalent to the given pattern will match it. The pattern can contain variables, denoted by IdentifierTree which name starts with the dollar ('$') sign. If the variable name ends with the dollar sign, it is considered to be a "multivariable", which means that any number of consequent tree node can be added to that variable. There may be a type constraint specified for each of the variables. If such a constraint is specified, the variable will be bound only to tree node which type is assignable to the constraint. TODO: variables for names TODO: repeated variables
        Parameters:
        pattern - to search for
        variable2Type -
        Returns:
        the pattern

      • createPatternWithFreeVariables

        @NonNull
public static Pattern createPatternWithFreeVariables(@NonNull
                                                              Iterable<? extends TreePath> pattern,
                                                              @NonNull
                                                              Map<String,TypeMirror> variable2Type)
        Creates a pattern that contains free variables for multiple consequent patterns. A sequence of tree nodes that are semantically equivalent to the given pattern nodes will match it. The pattern can contain variables, denoted by IdentifierTree which name starts with the dollar ('$') sign. If the variable name ends with the dollar sign, it is considered to be a "multivariable", which means that any number of consequent tree node can be added to that variable. There may be a type constraint specified for each of the variables. If such a constraint is specified, the variable will be bound only to tree node which type is assignable to the constraint. TODO: variables for names TODO: repeated variables
        Parameters:
        pattern - to search for
        variable2Type -
        Returns:
        the pattern
